Northeast

Entre Ríos

The 'Land Between Rivers' — thermal hot springs, riverside towns, and the famous Carnival of Gualeguaychú. A peaceful, affordable province between the Paraná and Uruguay rivers.

Airport
PRA (Paraná)
Thermal Springs
15+ resort towns
Rivers
Paraná and Uruguay
Known For
Hot springs, carnival, river fishing

About Entre Ríos

Entre Ríos lives up to its name — nestled between the Paraná and Uruguay rivers, the province is defined by water. The thermal hot springs circuit (Federación, Colón, Gualeguaychú) has made it a domestic tourism powerhouse, with natural hot springs resorts dotting the landscape. The riverside towns offer a gentler pace of life, with fishing, swimming, and asados by the water being the primary pastimes. Gualeguaychú hosts Argentina's biggest carnival — a feathered, sequined spectacle that rivals Rio. The capital Paraná sits on a bluff overlooking the Paraná River and offers a compact, livable city with colonial architecture and a strong sense of community. For expats, Entre Ríos offers extraordinarily affordable living in a peaceful, water-blessed landscape.

Expat Appeal

Retirees and those seeking a quiet, affordable river-town lifestyle with natural hot springs and a strong sense of community.

Cost of Living
$400–$800/month
Very Low

Estimated monthly budget for a single expat including rent, food, transport, and basic expenses.

Climate

Humid subtropical — hot summers (32°C+), mild winters (8-18°C), regular rainfall

Safety

Very safe throughout the province.

Internet

Basic to moderate — 10-30 Mbps in main cities.
